result.execSummary:
The defendant Lori A. Andresen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lori A. Andresen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lori A. Andresen was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Lori A. Andresen was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lori A. Andresen in court with attorney Anthony Lawrence O'Malley.  Defendant Lori A. Andresen in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CM158, 15CF17 and 14CF72  tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that the parties will also be dealing with 14CF72 today.
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the revocation packet; State has no corrrections.  Atty O'Malley has no objections.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant is being charged with Ct. 1 in 14CM158 and Ct. 3 in 15CF17 and will also be sentenced on 14CF72.  

Atty Hendee moves to amend the charge in 14CF72 to Disorderly Conduct, 947.01(1), Class B Misd.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations on all cases.
Atty O'Malley agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea to all cases.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 14CM158 and Ct. 3 in 15CF17 and the amended charge in 14CF72.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendations on all matters.
Atty O'Malley makes sentencing arguments.


BY THE COURT:  14CM158:  Court orders 90 days in the Marquette County Jail
Credit = 68 days
Good Time
Time Served

15CF17, Ct. 3:  Court orders 255 days in the Marquette County Jail
Credit = 192 days
Good Time 
Time Served 
Remaining costs on both cases to be paid while on Probation in 14CF72

14CF72:  Amended Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00
Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent

MARQUETTE COUNTY TREATMENT COURT PLEA AGREEMENT

Defendant Lori A. Andresen in court with attorney Jon R. Wilsnack and Attorney Matthew McCasland.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Treatment Court Coordinator Sheila Runge appears in court.
15CF17, 14CF72 & 14CM158 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that the parties have resolution today in which it involves treatment court.  
15CF17:
  Atty Wilsnack states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Atty Wilsnack states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.

  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1 & 3 in 15CF17, Ct. 1 in 14CF72 and Ct. 1 in 14CM158. Counts 2 & 4 in 15CF17 to be dismissed.
  Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of:  24 months with conditions on Ct. 1 in 14CF72 and Ct. 1 in 15CF17.
Atty McCasland agrees with the agreement. Atty Wilsnack agrees with the agreement.  
Court questions counsel on PSI.  Atty Hendee is not requesting a PSI.  Atty Wilsnack is not requesting a PSI.  Atty McCasland is not requesting a PSI.
Atty McCasland enters a No Contest plea to 14CF72 & 14CM158.  Atty Wilsnack enters a No Contest plea to 15CF17.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 3 in 15CF17 and Ct. 1 in 14CM158. Counts 2 & 4 in 15CF17 to be dismissed.
Court accepts defendant's plea and approves the 24 month DPA with conditions on Ct. 1 in 15CF17 and Ct. 1 in 14CF72.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty McCasland has no further recommendations.
Atty Wilsnack makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  15CF17:  Ct. 1 - Court signs the 24 month DPA with conditions that covers Ct. 1 in 15CF17 & Ct. 1 in 14CF72.
Ct. 3:  Withhold Sentence; Court orders 24 months Probation with conditions; concurrent with Ct. 1 in 14CM158.
30 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; stayed to be available for Treatment Court
